title: Java Programming using NetBeans
body:
Here is a simple algorithm to find the sum of digits of any number:

Say the number is n

s = 0;
while(n > 0){
   s = s + n%10;
   n = n/10;
}
System.out.println("Sum = " + s);

Here is what is happening. I will take an example and show you: Say n = 91

n%10 means the remainder when n is divided by 10.

In the first iteration, s becomes 0 + 91%10 = 1 Before the next iteration, we change n to n/10, as we have already got the last digit added to the sum s. n becomes 91/10 = 9

In the second iteration, s becomes 1 + 9%10 = 10 n becomes 9/10 = 0

The loop stops here and the sum is printed as 10.

Note: We are adding the sum from the last digit of the number to the first digit using the magic of the modulus operator( to get the current last digit) and the division operator( to curtail the number with its last digit removed)

Hope it is easy to understand!!!
